Interface EventListener<R,E>

Type Parameters:
R - the result of reception; almost always Void
E - the event type
All Superinterfaces:
Aggregate, AttributedTyped, EventListener
public interface EventListener<R,E> extends AttributedTyped, Aggregate, EventListener
An EventListener, an Aggregate, and an AttributedTyped that receives events.
Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • Events

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface Aggregate

    EMPTY_ASSIGNMENTS, EMPTY_DEPENDENCIES

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default AttributedType
    attributedType()
    Returns a non-null, determinate AttributedType describing the kinds of events this EventListener is prepared to handle.
    default SequencedSet<AttributedElement>
    dependencies()
    Returns a non-null, determinate, immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElements representing dependencies this EventListener has that must be resolved before any invocation of the eventReceived(Object, ReferencesSelector) method may properly occur.
    AttributedElement
    eventDependency()
    Returns a non-null, determinate AttributedElement representing the program element for which an event is destined.
    R
    eventReceived(E event, ReferencesSelector r)
    Receives and handles an event, normally as delivered by an invocation of the Events.fire(TypeMirror, List, Object, ReferencesSelector) method, returning the result (which is often Void (null)).

    Methods inherited from interface Aggregate

    assign

  • Method Details

    • attributedType

      default AttributedType attributedType()
      Returns a non-null, determinate AttributedType describing the kinds of events this EventListener is prepared to handle.

      The default implementation of this method extracts this information from an invocation of the eventDependency() method (q.v.).

      Specified by:
      attributedType in interface AttributedTyped
      Returns:
      a non-null, determinate AttributedType
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the default implementation of this method receives a null return value from an invocation of the eventDependency() method
      See Also:
      • eventDependency()

    • dependencies

      default SequencedSet<AttributedElement> dependencies()
      Returns a non-null, determinate, immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElements representing dependencies this EventListener has that must be resolved before any invocation of the eventReceived(Object, ReferencesSelector) method may properly occur.

      Implementations of this method must not include a result of any invocation of the eventDependency() method as an element of the return value.

      The default implementation of this method returns an empty SequencedSet. Overrides are expected.

      Specified by:
      dependencies in interface Aggregate
      Returns:
      a non-null, determinate, immutable SequencedSet of AttributedElements
      See Also:
      • eventReceived(Object, ReferencesSelector)
      • eventDependency()

    • eventDependency

      AttributedElement eventDependency()
      Returns a non-null, determinate AttributedElement representing the program element for which an event is destined.

      The result of an invocation of this method must not appear as an element of the return value of an invocation of the dependencies() method.

      Note that the default implementation of the attributedType() method calls this method and requires it to return a non-null value.

      Returns:
      a non-null, determinate AttributedElement
      See Also:
      • dependencies()

    • eventReceived

      R eventReceived(E event, ReferencesSelector r)
      Receives and handles an event, normally as delivered by an invocation of the Events.fire(TypeMirror, List, Object, ReferencesSelector) method, returning the result (which is often Void (null)).
      Parameters:
      event - the event; must not be null
      r - a ReferencesSelector typically used to assign dependencies; must not be null
      Returns:
      the result of reception, which may be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any argument is null
